title: BigUint64Array
markdown:
# BigUint64Array

The **`BigUint64Array`** typed array represents an array of 64-bit unsigned integers in the platform byte order. If control over byte order is needed, use [DataView](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/DataView) instead. The contents are initialized to `0n`. Once established, you can reference elements in the array using the object's methods, or by using standard array index syntax (that is, using bracket notation).

`BigUint64Array` is a subclass of the hidden [TypedArray](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray) class.

## [Constructor](#constructor)

[BigUint64Array()](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/BigUint64Array/BigUint64Array)

Creates a new `BigUint64Array` object.

## [Static properties](#static%5Fproperties)

_Also inherits static properties from its parent [TypedArray](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray)_.

[BigUint64Array.BYTES\_PER\_ELEMENT](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray/BYTES%5FPER%5FELEMENT)

Returns a number value of the element size. `8` in the case of `BigUint64Array`.

## [Static methods](#static%5Fmethods)

_Inherits static methods from its parent [TypedArray](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray)_.

## [Instance properties](#instance%5Fproperties)

_Also inherits instance properties from its parent [TypedArray](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray)_.

These properties are defined on `BigUint64Array.prototype` and shared by all `BigUint64Array` instances.

[BigUint64Array.prototype.BYTES\_PER\_ELEMENT](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray/BYTES%5FPER%5FELEMENT)

Returns a number value of the element size. `8` in the case of a `BigUint64Array`.

[BigUint64Array.prototype.constructor](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Object/constructor)

The constructor function that created the instance object. For `BigUint64Array` instances, the initial value is the [BigUint64Array](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/BigUint64Array/BigUint64Array) constructor.

## [Instance methods](#instance%5Fmethods)

_Inherits instance methods from its parent [TypedArray](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray)_.

## [Examples](#examples)

### [Different ways to create a BigUint64Array](#different%5Fways%5Fto%5Fcreate%5Fa%5Fbiguint64array)

```
// From a length
const biguint64 = new BigUint64Array(2);
biguint64[0] = 42n;
console.log(biguint64[0]); // 42n
console.log(biguint64.length); // 2
console.log(biguint64.BYTES_PER_ELEMENT); // 8

// From an array
const x = new BigUint64Array([21n, 31n]);
console.log(x[1]); // 31n

// From another TypedArray
const y = new BigUint64Array(x);
console.log(y[0]); // 21n

// From an ArrayBuffer
const buffer = new ArrayBuffer(64);
const z = new BigUint64Array(buffer, 8, 4);
console.log(z.byteOffset); // 8

// From an iterable
const iterable = (function* () {
  yield* [1n, 2n, 3n];
})();
const biguint64FromIterable = new BigUint64Array(iterable);
console.log(biguint64FromIterable);
// BigUint64Array [1n, 2n, 3n]

```

## [Specifications](#specifications)

| Specification                                                                                                                                     |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [ECMAScript Language Specification  \# sec-typedarray-objects](https://tc39.es/ecma262/multipage/indexed-collections.html#sec-typedarray-objects) |

## [Browser compatibility](#browser%5Fcompatibility)

BCD tables only load in the browser
